message.content:
You can use the following regex expression to extract a three character code from a filename in format "57-1Jn.usfm":

```regex
\d+-([a-zA-Z0-9]{3})\.usfm
```

This regular expression works as follows:

- `\d+` matches one or more digits at the beginning of the string.
- `-` matches a hyphen.
- `([a-zA-Z0-9]{3})` captures three characters that can be upper or lower case letters or digits.
- `\.usfm` matches the ".usfm" extension at the end of the string.

You can use this expression in your programming language of choice to extract the desired three character code from filenames in the specified format.
